results.title: Acupuncture
results.creator_credit: Celia Tait, Brian Beaton, Reel Images and SBS-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Nature of healing”.
The emphasis of acupuncture is on prevention rather than cure. First documented in ancient Chinese texts, acupuncture can be combined with other therapies to alleviate pain and is often used instead of anaesthesia. Cupping and acupressure use acupuncture techniques without the insertion of needles.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Celia Tait, Brian Beaton, Reel Images and SBS-TV

results.title: Meditation
results.creator_credit: Celia Tait, Brian Beaton, Reel Images and SBS-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “The Nature of healing”.
Meditation is an ancient practice used to enhance enlightenment by altering metabolic processes to induce restfulness. Business people, patients and school students, in fact, everyone can benefit from the various therapies shwon if meditation is part of a daily routine.

results.title: Movement
results.creator_credit: Celia Tait, Brian Beaton, Reel Images and SBS-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “The Nature of healing”.
This program introduces two natural therapies to change bad posture habits; the Alexander technique which corrects bad posture and increases the performance potential of athletes, singers, musicans and dancers; and the Feldenkrais method which enables people to alter poor movement habits. Includes footage of Alexander and Feldenkrais.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Celia Tait, Brian Beaton, Reel Images and SBS-TV

results.title: Margaret Atwood
results.creator_credit: Tracey Fisher, Tier One Communications and TV Ontario
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Authors at the harbourfront”.
Margaret Atwood launches her latest work ‘Cat’s eye’ which explores the world of childhood, secrecies, loyalties and betrayals.

results.title: American cinema
results.creator_credit: Greg Martinelli, Molly Ornati, Rita Mate, BBC, KCET (Television station : Los Angeles, Calif.) and New York Center for Visual History
results.brief_description: A 13 part series examining the cinema industry. Producers, directors, actors, cinematographers and Hollywood stars reveal insights into the business of making motion pictures. John Lithgow introduces each episode which encompasses a theme and examines it in detail with clips from some of the world’s renown films.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Greg Martinelli, Molly Ornati, Rita Mate, BBC, KCET (Television station : Los Angeles, Calif.) and New York Center for Visual History

results.title: Classical Hollywood style today
results.creator_credit: Greg Martinelli, Lorna Thomas, BBC, KCET (Television station : Los Angeles, Calif.) and New York Center for Visual History
results.brief_description:
Episode number 13 of Series “American cinema”.
This program offers interviews with contemporary directors, European film-makers, scholars, critics and studio-era veterans who probe Hollywood’s influence on both American and world culture.

results.title: Thinking and writing about film
results.creator_credit: Richard Smigielski, Brian Street, BBC, KCET (Television station : Los Angeles, Calif.) and New York Center for Visual History
results.brief_description:
Episode number 12 of Series “American cinema”.
Provides a formal and cultural analysis of a classical film sequence serving as a critical how-to guide for those new to film critique.

results.title: The Edge of Hollywood
results.creator_credit: Saskia Baron, Shana Swanson, BBC, KCET (Television station : Los Angeles, Calif.) and New York Center for Visual History
results.brief_description:
Episode number 10 of Series “American cinema”.
While many of the old rules are still in force, independent filmmakers often add their dissineting voices to the forum. This program looks at some alternative visions from new talents including Spike Lee, Joel and Ethan Coen, Jim Jarmusch and Quentin Tarantino. With limited budgets, they are challenging the stylistic status quo of the Hollywood film.
